member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.#ctor(NodePtr,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new component and adds it to the specified node. The created component will be associated with the node property having the specified number.
member.param: Node, to which the created component is to be added.
Number of the node property, with which the created component will be associated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getClassName
member.summary: Returns the name of the class associated with the component.
member.returns: Component class name.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getPropertyName
member.summary: Returns the name of the property associated with the component.
member.returns: Property name.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.save_property(char)
member.summary: Saves all parameters of the property associated with the component to the specified prop-file.
member.param: Name of the target .prop-file.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.setEnabled(int)
member.summary: Enables or disables the component.
member.param: Use 1 to enable the component, 0 - to disable it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isEnabled
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the component is enabled.
member.returns: 1 if the component is enabled; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isInitialized
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the component is initialized (its init() method was already called).
member.returns: 1 if the component is initialized; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isAutoSaveProperty
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the property file associated with the component should be automatically generated each time C++ Component System is initialized or createPropertyFiles() method is called. By default all components have their property files re-generated automatically, this behavior might not be suitable, when you modify properties manually after creation. In this case you can add the following macro to the header file containing your component's declaration:
member.returns: 1 if the property file associated with the component should be automatically generated each time C++ Component System is initialized or createPropertyFiles() method is called; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getProperty
member.summary: Returns the property associated with the component.
member.returns: Property associated with the component.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getPropertyNum
member.summary: Returns the number of the property associated with the component.
member.returns: Number of the property in the list of properties assigned to the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.addComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Adds the component to the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::addComponent() method.
member.param: Node, to which the component is to be added.
member.returns: Pointer to the new added component, if it was successfully added to the specified node; otherwise nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.removeComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Removes the component from the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::removeComponent() method.
member.param: Node, from which the component is to be removed.
member.returns: 1 if the component was successfully removed from the specified node; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of the specified type associated with the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponent() method.
member.param: Node, for which the component of this type is to be found.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponents(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Returns all components of this type assigned to the specified node and puts them to the specified buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponents() method.
member.param: Node, whose components are to be retrieved.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentInChildren(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of this type found among all the children of the specified node (including the node itself). This method searches for the component in the following order: node itself node reference node's children children of node's children This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentInChildren() method.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentsInChildren(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Searches for all components of this type down the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentsInChildren() method.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentInParent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of this type found among all predecessors and posessors of the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentInParent() method.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentsInParent(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Searches for all components of this type up the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentsInParent() method.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getNode
member.summary: Returns the node, to which the component is attached.
member.returns: Node, to which the component is attached.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.setDestroyCallback(Unigine.CallbackBase)
member.summary: Sets a callback function to be called before destroying the component. This function can be used to implement certain actions to be performed when a component is destroyed.
member.param: Callback function.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.clearDestroyCallback
member.summary: Removes a destroy callback function previously set by the setDestroyCallback() method. This callback function can be used to implement certain actions to be performed when a component is destroyed.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.on_enable
member.summary: This method is called by the Engine, when the component becomes enabled and active (both, node and property are enabled). You can override this method to implement some specific actions to be performed each time, when the component becomes enabled and active.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.on_disable
member.summary: This method is called by the Engine, when the component becomes disabled (both, node and property are disabled). You can override this method to implement some specific actions to be performed each time, when the component becomes disabled and inactive.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.init
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world initialization. Put you code for resources initialization during the world start here.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.update
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each render frame. You can specify here all logic-related functions you want to be called every frame while your application executes.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.postUpdate
member.summary: Engine calls this function after updating each render frame. You can correct behavior after the state of the node has been updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.updatePhysics
member.summary: Engine calls this function before updating each physics frame. Here you can control physics, perform continuous physics-related operations (pushing a car forward depending on current motor's RPM, simulating a wind blowing constantly, perform immediate collision response, etc.). The engine calls updatePhysics() with the fixed rate (60 times per second by default) regardless of the fps number. Similar to the world script's updatePhysics() function.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.shutdown
member.summary: Engine calls this function on world shutdown. Here you can clean up resources that were created during world script execution to avoid memory leaks.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentBase.is_equals(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the two xml nodes are actually equal (have the same set of parameters with the same values and the same hierarchy).
member.param: First xml node.
Second xml node.
member.returns: 1 if the two specified xml nodes are equal; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.get
member.summary: Returns a pointer to C++ Component System. This pointer must be obtained to access functions of C++ Component System:

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.initialize
member.summary: Performs initialization of C++ Component System, registration of all components and creation of all necessary property files. This method should me called in the AppSystemLogic::init() method. If a property file for any component does not exist, it will be created automatically.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getNumComponents
member.summary: Returns the total number of components registered in C++ Component System. This method is very slow and should not be used often.
member.returns: Total number of registered components.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getNumNodesWithComponents
member.summary: Returns the total number of nodes with components assigned.
member.returns: Total number of nodes with components assigned.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFile
member.summary: Creates a property file for a registered component associated with the property with a given name.Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If this property file does not exist, it will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder with a name obtained by the component's getPropertyName() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFile(char)
member.summary: Creates a property file for a registered component associated with the property with a given name. Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If this property file does not exist, it will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder.
member.param: Name of the property associated with the component.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFiles
member.summary: Creates property files for all registered components. Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If these property files do not exist, they will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.refreshProperty(char)
member.summary: Rewrites the *.prop file for the specified property and reloads it in the Property Manager.
member.param: Property name.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.refreshProperty
member.summary: Rewrites the property file for the specified component and reloads it in the Property Manager.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.registerComponent
member.summary: Registers a user component derived from the ComponentBase class. Components must be registered in the AppSystemLogic::init() method. If a property file for the component does not exist, it will be created automatically.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.addComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Adds the component to the specified node.
member.param: Node, to which the component is to be added.
member.returns: Pointer to the new added component, if it was successfully added to the specified node; otherwise nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of the specified type associated with the given node.
member.param: Node, for which the component of the specified type is to be found.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponents(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
member.summary: Searches for all components of the specified type assigned to the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
member.param: Node, for which the components of the specified type are to be found.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added.

Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentInChildren(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of the specified type found among all the children of the specified node (including the node itself). This method searches for the component in the following order: node itself node reference node's children children of node's children
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the specified type of component.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentsInChildren(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
member.summary: Searches for all components of the specified type down the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added.

Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentInParent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Returns the first component of the specified type found among all predecessors and posessors of the specified node.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked.
member.returns: Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentsInParent(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
member.summary: Searches for all components of the specified type up the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
member.param: Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked.
Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added.

Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.removeComponent(NodePtr)
member.summary: Removes the component from the specified node.
member.param: Node, from which the component is to be removed.
member.returns: 1 if the component was successfully removed from the specified node; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.setWarningLevel(int)
member.summary: Sets the warning level for C++ Component System. Warnings can be very useful when debugging your application, e.g. to investigate Null Reference Exception cases.
member.param: New warning level to be set. One of the following values:WARNING_LEVEL::NONE - warning messages are disabled.WARNING_LEVEL::LOW - warning messages are generated only for serious cases.WARNING_LEVEL::HIGH - warning messages are generated for all cases including potential ones. At this level, for example, all Node/Property/Material parameters, that are empty at startup, will be reported.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getWarningLevel
member.summary: Returns the current warning level for C++ Component System. Warnings can be very useful when debugging your application, e.g. to investigate Null Reference Exception cases.
member.returns: Current warning level. One of the following values:WARNING_LEVEL::NONE - warning messages are disabled.WARNING_LEVEL::LOW - warning messages are generated only for serious cases.WARNING_LEVEL::HIGH - warning messages are generated for all cases including potential ones. At this level, for example, all Node/Property/Material parameters, that are empty at startup, will be reported.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.getParameter const
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the corresponding property parameter.
member.returns: Pointer to the property parameter.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.size
member.summary: Returns the number of elements in the array. This method is for the array and array structure component parameters.
member.returns: Number of elements in the array.

member.name: M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.operator[](int)
member.summary: Returns the reference to the requested element. This method is for the array and array structure component parameters.
member.param: Position of the element to return.
member.returns: Reference to the requested element.
